com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management

Interface VirtualMachineClasses

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, Service, VirtualMachineClassesTypes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualMachineClassesStub

    public interface VirtualMachineClasses
extends Service, VirtualMachineClassesTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The VirtualMachineClasses interface provides management methods for customizable virtual machine classes. A virtual machine class represents a policy and configuration resource which defines a set of attributes to be used in the configuration of a virtual machine instance. This interface was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.00100.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        VirtualMachineClasses.CreateInvocation create(VirtualMachineClassesTypes.CreateSpec spec)
        Create a VM class object. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.00100.
        Parameters:
        spec - Information about the VM class object to be created.
        Returns:
        instance of VirtualMachineClasses.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExists - if a VM class by the name as specified in the spec already exists in the vCenter inventory.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if the input refers to an invalid storage policy or if the input spec includes settings that are out of acceptable bounds or a combination of settings that are not internally consistent with the input spec.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have VirtualMachineClasses.Manage privilege.

      • update

        VirtualMachineClasses.UpdateInvocation update(java.lang.String vmClass,
                                              VirtualMachineClassesTypes.UpdateSpec spec)
        Update the configuration of the VM class object. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.00100.
        Parameters:
        vmClass - Identifier for the VM class. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.VirtualMachineClass.
        spec - Information about the VM class object to be updated.
        Returns:
        instance of VirtualMachineClasses.UpdateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described update operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExists - if a VM class by the name as specified in the spec already exists in the vCenter inventory.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if the input refers to an invalid storage policy or if the input spec includes settings that are out of acceptable bounds or a combination of settings that are not internally consistent with the input spec.
        NotFound - if or the vmClass cannot be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have VirtualMachineClasses.Manage privilege.

      • get

        VirtualMachineClasses.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String vmClass)
        Return information about a VM class. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.2.00100.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about the specified VM class.

        Parameters:
        vmClass - Identifier for the VM class. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.VirtualMachineClass.
        Returns:
        instance of VirtualMachineClasses.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        NotFound - if VM class can not be found in the vCenter inventory.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have System.Read privilege.
